746F806D6565748061806E657780676F616C3ACCF20EF232806D696C6C696F6EF30EF3806D6F72



      In his State of the Union address, the President said "We must act to meet a new goal:
     ·2 million more people off the welfare rolls by the year 2000." 'People off the rolls'
      includes adults and their children; it includes adults who go to work as well as adults
      who leave welfare for other reasons (i.e., they get married or start getting child support
      and no longer need welfare).

     The President has also set a goal of one million adults in work by the year 2000. His
     $3 billion welfare to work proposal, announced during the campaign and included in the
     budget agreement, is designed to move these million welfare recipients into jobs. In
     the year 2000, approximately one million adults must be working in order to meet the
     welfare law's participation rates. If a million welfare recipients are working in the year
     2000, it is possible that the welfare rolls will have declined by more than
     2 million people, but the goal in the State of the Union was set at a round 2 million
     people off the rolls.

                                                                Hex-Dump Conversion
